instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MISSING  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>   however when I trigger the on and off pad L7520  spikes to 5V , any ideas what that means or where I should look further ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check if other coils pulse too.
Also check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.
Take a look at voltages from page 58 too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pauses , L7560 is steady 3.3V, L7430 pauses as well, ( when I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>). On page 58 non of the SO RAILS are present , 3. 3V SUS , is present ,3. 3V S4 is present ., 3. 3V S3 SWITCH is 0.063V on page 58

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"pauses"
Pulses???

On page 58 check if S3 and S0 volatges pulse at least.
Be sure no short on any output rail.

Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pulses?
What about CPU cois (L7310/20)?

"and inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: S3 AND SO PULSES WHEN I TRIGGERED ON/OFF PAD , PIN 3 OF <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> PULSES and no signs of corrosion , L7310/20 all pulses when I trigger on/off pad ... I could not find a short on the output

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then all voltages from page 58 should pulse too; apart of the steady ones.
Try new BIOS; search on the forum, already something uploaded.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: does shortenings the on/off pads not same as SMC BY PASS ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Search the forum, or use Google.
You cannot waste time for a confirmation, when you can get it yourself in a minute...
